thread.title: Rutgers injury report: Receiver John Tsimis out for Michigan State game
thread.title_full: Rutgers injury report: Receiver John Tsimis out for Michigan State game

author: Dan Duggan | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Rutgers injury report: Receiver John Tsimis out for Michigan State game
text:
Comments 
PISCATAWAY â€” The bye week didn't work any healing powers on the Rutgers football team. 
While the week off gave some players a chance to recover, there were a few additions on the updated injury report released on Monday. Most notably, wide receiver John Tsimis (lower body) has been ruled out for Saturday's home game against Michigan State (8 p.m., BTN) . 
Tsimis missed most of training camp and the first two games of the season with a lower body injury. He made his debut in a 28-3 loss to Penn State on Sept. 19 and caught two passes for 10 yards. 
Tsimis was not listed on the injury report before Rutgers' 27-14 win over Kansas before the bye, but he did not record a catch in the game. Tsimis had 19 catches for 188 yards and three touchdowns last season. 
Freshman cornerback Jarius Adams was added to the report with an upper body injury. The team's No. 3 cornerback, Adams is listed as questionable for the Michigan State game. With Adams' status in doubt, redshirt junior walk-on Brian Verbitski has been added to the two-deep behind starting corner Isaiah Wharton. 
PLUS: How big of an underdog is Rutgers against Michigan State? 
Starting strong safety Davon Jacobs again is listed as questionable with an upper body injury. Jacobs missed the Kansas game after being added to the injury report during the week . Redshirt freshman Kiy Hester is in line to start again in Jacobs' place. 
"The injury report is what it is," interim coach Norries Wilson said. "We're going to coach the guys that show up out there that the trainer staff and medical staff say are cleared to participate and we'll drive on from there." 
Four players were removed from the injury report: Running back Paul James, punter Tim Gleeson, wide receiver Jawuan Harris and offensive lineman Jacquis Webb. Harris and Webb had been listed as out with lower body injuries on every injury report this season. James, who has started all four games at running back, had been listed as probable with a lower body injury on previous reports. 
Here is the full injury report: 
OL Zack Heeman (Lower body): Probable 
CB Ronnie James (Lower body): Probable 
DE Djwany Mera (Lower body): Probable 
OL Chris Muller (Lower body): Probable 
DE Kemoko Turay (Upper body): Probable 
CB Jarius Adams (Upper body): Questionable 
SS Davon Jacobs (Upper body): Questionable 
TE George Behr (Lower body): Out 
WR Dontae Owens (Lower body): Out 
RB Desmon Peoples (Upper body): Out 
LB Nick Rafferty (Upper body): Out 
LB Austin Rosa (Lower body): Out 
RB Charles Snorweah (Upper body): Out 
WR John Tsimis (Lower body): Out 
DT Darius Hamilton (Lower body): Out for season 
LB T.J. Taylor (Knee): Out for season
